articleTitleTranslated: Walkner starts in the seventh Dakar
articleContent: 2018 hatte er die Dakar gewonnen, heuer im JÃ¤nner kam er auf Rang fÃ¼nf, wobei die KTM-Siegesserie beendet wurde. Diesmal sind fÃ¼r die Endabrechnung die Top Drei das erklÃ¤rte Ziel Walkners.

Aufgrund der Coronavirus-Pandemie gab es diesmal nur ein Vorbereitungsrennen, bei der Andalusien Rallye wurde Walkner im Oktober Sechster. Zuletzt hatte er mit der KTM-Truppe bei einem rund vier Wochen langen Trainingslager in Dubai versucht, fÃ¼r den Klassiker zu Jahresbeginn in Schwung zu kommen.
Am 26.  Dezember erfolgt der Abflug ins Abenteuer, ein negativer Coronavirus-Test muss dabei sein. Dort angekommen, wird noch einmal getestet, bevor es in eine dreitÃ¤gige HotelquarantÃ¤ne geht.

Ich freue mich schon darauf, dass es losgeht.â€œ Damit punkto Coronavirus vor der Abreise nichts mehr passiert, wird auf die Weihnachtsfeier im grÃ¶ÃŸeren Familienkreis diesmal verzichtet bzw. das nach der Dakar nachgeholt.

Wenn Walkner zu Jahresende in Saudi-Arabien ankommt, werden auf ihn nicht nur die bereits hingeschickten Koffer u. a. mit Grundnahrungsmitteln warten, sondern auch die intensivere BeschÃ¤ftigung mit einigen RegelÃ¤nderungen.

Ich habe herausgefunden, dass wenn ich lÃ¤nger mit hÃ¶herer Geschwindigkeit unterwegs war, diese Brille auf den Sehnerv oder auf die Stirn drÃ¼ckt und etwas beeintrÃ¤chtigt wurde und ich so fÃ¼r eine halbe Stunde eine SichtfeldeinschrÃ¤nkung gehabt habe.

Es ist aber wichtig, den richtigen Durchblick zu haben. â€œRoadbook erst 20 Minuten vor Start Neu bei der Dakar ist auch, dass es das Roadbook nun erst 20 Minuten vor dem Start geben wird â€“ bei den MotorrÃ¤dern in Papier.

Das Risiko, dass im Roadbook etwas falsch ist, ist schon sehr, sehr groÃŸ.â€œ Das geht primÃ¤r zulasten des Ersten auf der Strecke. â€Nicht falsch taktierenâ€œ, gab sich Walkner als Devise.

Die inklusive Fahrer rund 40-kÃ¶pfige KTM-Crew wird sich auch mit den bei der Dakar neu eingefÃ¼hrten Airbag-Westen beschÃ¤ftigen mÃ¼ssen. Walkner begrÃ¼ÃŸt diesen Schritt aus sicherheitstechnischer Sicht, fÃ¼r die Bewegungsfreiheit mÃ¼sse man aber noch eine LÃ¶sung finden.

â€Ich glaube, da ist noch Luft nach oben.â€œ Heinz Kinigadner, Motorsportberater bei KTM, will auch da das Optimum herausholen: â€Bei den Tests Ã¼berlassen wir nichts dem Zufall. Wir gehen bestvorbereitet an den Start.â€œ Der 60-JÃ¤hrige sieht ebenfalls die Top Drei als Ziel.

Kinigadner: â€Brabec ist einer, der das Risiko nicht scheut â€“ der hat keinen Fehler gemacht und eine Topleistung abgeliefert. Den musst du fast in einen Fehler treiben . â€œ
articleContentTranslated: In 2018 he won the Dakar, this year in January he came in fifth, ending the KTM winning streak. This time the top three are the declared goal of Walkner for the final bill.

Due to the coronavirus pandemic, there was only one preparatory race this time; Walkner finished sixth in the Andalusia Rally in October. Most recently, he tried to get going for the classic at the beginning of the year with the KTM troop at a training camp in Dubai that lasted around four weeks.
The adventure takes off on December 26th, and a negative coronavirus test must be included. Once there, it is tested again before it goes into a three-day hotel quarantine.

Resolving difficulty concentrating.While Walkner noticed the long break from racing a good two months ago in Spain - he hadn't competed in any competition since January - and then complained about lack of concentration, he worked on it successfully in Dubai.
â€œI had a total of almost 20 driving days. You can tell that such a large block brings a lot more than just a week "

After a number of road books we drove, countless navigation kilometers were reeled off. Routine is important "I noticed that I only really got back into it after ten days of driving, that everything was automated and that I was really starting to work," reported the 34-year-old. "

â€œI really feel extremely well prepared and I am extremely confident. I'm already looking forward to getting started. â€So that nothing more happens with regard to the coronavirus before departure, the Christmas party in the larger family circle will be dispensed with this time or it will be done after the Dakar.

When Walkner arrives in Saudi Arabia at the end of the year, not only will the suitcases and the like that have already been sent be on him. a. waiting with basic food, but also the more intensive preoccupation with some rule changes.

One concerns the tires, the use of only six rear tires is permitted. In addition, they can only be of one make. Walkner: â€œThis decision is relatively easy. The only option is the Michelin Desert, the others wouldn't be able to take it.
â€œThe stones are dangerous. The KTM factory rider would like to wait and see how the restriction on the number of tires will work out.
"It won't be so tragic with sand, but it will be exciting on a typical stone stage." In principle, it is possible to drive through with one tire, but everything is more exhausted with it.

â€œThat doesn't make it any less dangerous over 1,500 km. The braking distance, the acceleration, the controllability - that all has a different effect. â€Monday motivation !!!! ğŸ™ŒğŸ»ğŸ’ª Unfortunately, the video never comes across as it actually feels, but it was a long jump !!!?

ğŸ˜… ... 139km / h and a good 50 metersPosted by Matthias Walkner on Monday, December 7, 2020 This should also be the case for his new glasses, in Dubai he became aware of a shortcoming. â€œI had a bit of a problem with the field of vision.

I found out that when I was traveling at a higher speed for a long time, these glasses pressed on the optic nerve or on the forehead and became somewhat impaired and I had a restricted field of view for half an hour.

But it is important to have the right perspective. â€œRoad book only 20 minutes before the start is also new to the Dakar that the road book will now only be available 20 minutes before the start - on paper for the motorcycles.
"That is unnecessary, it just creates a lot of stress," said Walkner. Still, it will affect his tactics. â€œIt is best to always drive around between positions three and six.
The risk that something is wrong in the road book is very, very high. â€That is primarily at the expense of the first one on the route. â€œDon't tact the wrong way,â€ was Walkner's motto.

The KTM crew of around 40 including drivers will also have to deal with the airbag vests that were newly introduced at the Dakar. Walkner welcomes this step from a safety point of view, but a solution still has to be found for freedom of movement.

â€œI think there is still room for improvement.â€ Heinz Kinigadner, motorsport consultant at KTM, wants to get the most out of this as well: â€œWe don't leave anything to chance in the tests. We are well prepared for the start. â€The 60-year-old also sees the top three as the goal.

"That must be the big goal," said the Tyrolean on Tuesday at a virtual press conference. He especially fears defending champion Ricky Brabec. In January, the American finished the 18-year KTM Dakar series of victories on a Honda on a Honda.
Kinigadner: â€œBrabec is someone who isn't afraid of taking risks - he didn't make a mistake and delivered a top performance. You almost have to drive him into a mistake. "
